svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
April 27, 2024" date: "2024-04-27"
Eth News and Links
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video .Â Notes from Tim Beiko &
Christine Kim : Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) Pectra-devnet-0 :
added EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests; client team implementations
progressing though Erigon may be delayed as implementing on Erigon v3 EIP3074 :
discussions on DELEGATECALL, nonce, revocation, chain ID and some late account
abstraction opposition; no changes for devnet-0, breakout planned EIPs added to Pectra
considered for inclusion : EIP7212 secp256r1 precompile SSZ : async update EOF :
discussion on potentially reducing scope L1/L2 governance discussion
* Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) Pectra-devnet-0 : added EIP7685
general purpose execution layer requests; client team implementations progressing
though Erigon may be delayed as implementing on Erigon v3 EIP3074 : discussions on
DELEGATECALL, nonce, revocation, chain ID and some late account abstraction
opposition; no changes for devnet-0, breakout planned EIPs added to Pectra considered
for inclusion : EIP7212 secp256r1 precompile SSZ : async update EOF : discussion on
potentially reducing scope L1/L2 governance discussion
* Pectra-devnet-0 : added EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests; client
team implementations progressing though Erigon may be delayed as implementing on
Erigon v3
Pectra-devnet-0 : added EIP7685 general purpose execution layer requests; client team
implementations progressing though Erigon may be delayed as implementing on Erigon v3
* EIP3074 : discussions on DELEGATECALL, nonce, revocation, chain ID and some late
account abstraction opposition; no changes for devnet-0, breakout planned
EIP3074 : discussions on DELEGATECALL, nonce, revocation, chain ID and some late
* EIPs added to Pectra considered for inclusion : EIP7212 secp256r1 precompile
EIPs added to Pectra considered for inclusion :
* EIP7212 secp256r1 precompile
* SSZ : async update
SSZ : async update
* EOF : discussion on potentially reducing scope
EOF : discussion on potentially reducing scope
* L1/L2 governance discussion
L1/L2 governance discussion
Osaka + F starname upgrade (meta EIP7607 )
* Verkle: Implementers call video & notes : Kaustinen testnet v6 launched,
presentations on potentially storing Verkle state in Portal Network and Verkle + EOF
Are Verkle proofs more ZK friendly ? Daniel Lubarov says it depends
* Implementers call video & notes : Kaustinen testnet v6 launched, presentations on
potentially storing Verkle state in Portal Network and Verkle + EOF
Implementers call video & notes : Kaustinen testnet v6 launched, presentations on
* Are Verkle proofs more ZK friendly ? Daniel Lubarov says it depends
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.69% still too close to 33.3% threshold
ðŸš¨ Lido at 28.69% still too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
Execution layer: Geth ~63% majority
* Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
Consensus layer: Prysm 38%
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* ePBS: Terence: ePBS annotated validator spec Barnabe: APS-Burn , alternative to
execution tickets for attester-proposer separation
ePBS:
* Terence: ePBS annotated validator spec
Terence: ePBS annotated validator spec
* Barnabe: APS-Burn , alternative to execution tickets for attester-proposer
separation
Barnabe: APS-Burn , alternative to execution tickets for attester-proposer separation
* Uncrowdable Inclusion Lists to uphold chain neutrality
Uncrowdable Inclusion Lists to uphold chain neutrality
* EIP7657 sync committee slashings explainer, improves security for light client
bridges
EIP7657 sync committee slashings explainer, improves security for light client bridges
* Ethereum Protocol Fellowship: EPF.wiki & recap of cohort 4 projects
Ethereum Protocol Fellowship: EPF.wiki & recap of cohort 4 projects
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.18.0 : fixes cross-client, DVT & remote signer
compatibility issues and defaults to local block if external builder less than 10%
additional value Teku v24.4.0 : performance improvements
Consensus layer:
* Lodestar v1.18.0 : fixes cross-client, DVT & remote signer compatibility issues and
defaults to local block if external builder less than 10% additional value
Lodestar v1.18.0 : fixes cross-client, DVT & remote signer compatibility issues and
* Teku v24.4.0 : performance improvements
Teku v24.4.0 : performance improvements
* Execution layer: Geth v1.14.0 : defaults to pathdb, adds live tracing, drops support
for pre-merge networks, pending block only constructed on demand and adds beacon chain
light client Nethermind v1.26.0 : adds snap server support and HalfPath state database
upgrade Reth v0.2.0-beta.6 : fixes critical bug that would lead to invalid trie state
and adds Discv5 support
Execution layer:
* Geth v1.14.0 : defaults to pathdb, adds live tracing, drops support for pre-merge
networks, pending block only constructed on demand and adds beacon chain light client
Geth v1.14.0 : defaults to pathdb, adds live tracing, drops support for pre-merge
* Nethermind v1.26.0 : adds snap server support and HalfPath state database upgrade
Nethermind v1.26.0 : adds snap server support and HalfPath state database upgrade
* Reth v0.2.0-beta.6 : fixes critical bug that would lead to invalid trie state and
adds Discv5 support
Reth v0.2.0-beta.6 : fixes critical bug that would lead to invalid trie state and adds
Discv5 support
Layer 2
* Optimism disclosed two issues in FaultDisputeGame contract found by Offchain Labs
Optimism disclosed two issues in FaultDisputeGame contract found by Offchain Labs
* Blob market analysis : Base & Optimism use a blob-maximization strategy
Blob market analysis : Base & Optimism use a blob-maximization strategy
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7697 : AUTHCREATE opcode EIP7698 : EOF - creation transaction
EIPs:
* EIP7697 : AUTHCREATE opcode
EIP7697 : AUTHCREATE opcode
* EIP7698 : EOF - creation transaction
EIP7698 : EOF - creation transaction
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7699 : ERC20 payment reference extension
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7699 : ERC20 payment reference extension
Stuff for developers
* Remix v0.48 : supports using multiple browser wallets (EIP6963), added PLONK scripts
to zk proof templates and added CREATE2 factory for deploying
Remix v0.48 : supports using multiple browser wallets (EIP6963), added PLONK scripts
* Guide to Hardhat Ignition contract verification on Etherscan
Guide to Hardhat Ignition contract verification on Etherscan
* Safe singleton factory deployer (Solidity): for using the factory with Foundry
deployment scripts
Safe singleton factory deployer (Solidity): for using the factory with Foundry
* Forge AlphaNet (Solidity): libraries for AlphaNet, EIP2537 BLS precompiles, RIP7212
Secp256r1 precompile and EIP3074 invokers
Forge AlphaNet (Solidity): libraries for AlphaNet, EIP2537 BLS precompiles, RIP7212
* Snekmate (Vyper contracts): added Echidna-based property tests for ERC20/721
contracts
Snekmate (Vyper contracts): added Echidna-based property tests for ERC20/721 contracts
* Guide to integrate Permit2 into Vyper contracts
Guide to integrate Permit2 into Vyper contracts
* Dpack-py (EVM packaging format): share addresses & artifacts to interact with
Dpack-py (EVM packaging format): share addresses & artifacts to interact with
* web3.py: guide to Bloom filters
web3.py: guide to Bloom filters
* Tenderly virtual testnets for dapp developers, uses mainnet state, with a faucet,
RPC, explorer & debugging tools
Tenderly virtual testnets for dapp developers, uses mainnet state, with a faucet, RPC,
explorer & debugging tools
* Privacy and Scaling Explorations core program : 8 week hybrid course for students in
Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Costa Rica, Ecuador & Argentina, apply by April 30
Privacy and Scaling Explorations core program : 8 week hybrid course for students in
Security
* Magpie (cross-chain swaps) $129k exploit via position of function selector not being
checked
Magpie (cross-chain swaps) $129k exploit via position of function selector not being
* Rico $36k exploit on Arbitrum via flash loan entry point
Rico $36k exploit on Arbitrum via flash loan entry point
Ecosystem
* Reth (execution layer client) scaling roadmap to 1 gigagas per second for L2 PÃ©ter
SzilÃ¡gyi (Geth): would need heavy tradeoffs
Reth (execution layer client) scaling roadmap to 1 gigagas per second for L2
* PÃ©ter SzilÃ¡gyi (Geth): would need heavy tradeoffs
* ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum finalists
ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum finalists
* Dan Finlay: history of eth_sign in MetaMask
Dan Finlay: history of eth_sign in MetaMask
Enterprise
* Stripe to support accepting stablecoin payments mid-year
Stripe to support accepting stablecoin payments mid-year
* Visa: stablecoin dashboard
Visa: stablecoin dashboard
* EEA: Week in Enterprise Ethereum News weekly newsletter
EEA: Week in Enterprise Ethereum News weekly newsletter
Job Listings
* Nethermind: Mechanism Designer and Research Engineer
Nethermind: Mechanism Designer and Research Engineer
* Devcon: Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
Devcon: Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
* EF: People Operations Support
EF: People Operations Support
* ChainSafe: Developer Relations - Sygma and Senior Product Manager
ChainSafe: Developer Relations - Sygma and Senior Product Manager
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 4.0 to 52.9 gwei, with 9.9 gwei average Zero net
issuance currently at 23.1 gwei 10k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 4.0 to 52.9 gwei, with 9.9 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 23.1 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 23.1 gwei
* 10k ETH net issuance this week
10k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $3,039 - $3,281, currently $3,089
ETHUSD : $3,039 - $3,281, currently $3,089
* ETHBTC : currently 0.049 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.049 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* ENS .box integration : tokenized top level domain
ENS .box integration : tokenized top level domain
* Safe{Pass} : points campaign announced to incentivize moving away from EOA
Safe{Pass} : points campaign announced to incentivize moving away from EOA
* Renzo ezETH depegged , airdrop criticized
Renzo ezETH depegged , airdrop criticized
* Gitcoin Grants 20 live on Arbitrum; open source software rounds: infrastructure, dev
tooling, apps and hackathon alumni
Gitcoin Grants 20 live on Arbitrum; open source software rounds: infrastructure, dev
Regulation/business/tokens
* Consensys received Wells notice from SEC for allegedly violating securities laws
with MetaMask Swaps & MetaMask Staking
Consensys received Wells notice from SEC for allegedly violating securities laws with
MetaMask Swaps & MetaMask Staking
* Samourai wallet founders charged in US for operating non-custodial Bitcoin
coinjoiner
Samourai wallet founders charged in US for operating non-custodial Bitcoin coinjoiner
* UK National Crime Agency & police gain power to seize crypto without an arrest
UK National Crime Agency & police gain power to seize crypto without an arrest
General
* Rekt: ZKasino rugpull
Rekt: ZKasino rugpull
* Manuel Araoz: tools to defend your attention
Manuel Araoz: tools to defend your attention
* Android TVs can expose email inbox
Android TVs can expose email inbox
* Polygon zkEVM integrated optimal Ate pairing over BLS by taking the 381 bit field
and overloading onto 256 bit registers
Polygon zkEVM integrated optimal Ate pairing over BLS by taking the 381 bit field and
overloading onto 256 bit registers
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-april-27-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
